item.title: 5/12: CBS Weekend News
item.description: Palestinians flee Rafah as fighting continues; Artists in 4 cities create murals to celebrate moms

item.title: Lost in Translation (2004) | 60 Minutes Archive
item.description: In 2004, Mike Wallace spoke to a Dutch reporter, who saw firsthand how North Korea was using "The Diary of a Young Girl" — the chronicle of Anne Frank, to teach students to fear and hate America.

item.title: Marine veteran explains alleged fake kidnapping plot to help North Koreans defect
item.description: A U.S. Marine veteran says he was part of a failed fake kidnapping plot designed to help North Koreans in Spain defect. He’s facing charges in Spain, where he believes he is at risk of assassination.

item.title: Reporting on the battle with Hezbollah in Metula, Israel
item.description: Lesley Stahl and a 60 Minutes team sheltered in a bunker during a drone attack on an Israeli border town that has increasingly come under fire from Hezbollah militants.

item.title: Key Bridge controlled demolition postponed due to weather
item.description: The controlled demolition of the largest remaining steel span of the collapsed Francis Scott Key Bridge in Baltimore has been postponed because of weather conditions.

item.title: Israel faces Iranian-backed Hamas to the south and Hezbollah to the north | 60 Minutes
item.description: Israel, preparing for a possible Rafah invasion, faces increased tension with the U.S. over the Gaza humanitarian crisis. To the north, it’s also confronting Hezbollah attacks coming in from Lebanon.

item.title: Pope Francis to sit down with 60 Minutes
item.description: Pope Francis will sit down with 60 Minutes next Sunday for a wide-ranging and exceedingly rare conversation from his Vatican guest house home. Norah O'Donnell reports.

item.title: 5/12/2024: A Week in Israel; A Web of Intrigue
item.description: First, a report on Israel's fronts: Hamas, Hezbollah, Iran. And, a look at a Marine veteran’s work to help North Koreans.

item.title: 5/12: The Takeout: Rep. Jasmine Crockett
item.description: Democratic Rep. Jasmine Crockett joins Major Garrett to discuss her role as a freshman House Representative. Rep. Crockett discusses Marjorie Taylor Greene's efforts to remove House Speaker Mike Johnson, plus top-of-mind issues such as immigration, the war in Gaza and protests on American college campuses.

item.title: The North Korean threat (2017) | 60 Minutes Archive
item.description: In 2017, Bill Whitaker reported on the continuing military threat posed by North Korea, a threat exacerbated by dictator Kim Jong-un's possession of nuclear weapons and his pursuit of an intercontinental ballistic missile.

item.title: Duke graduates walk out ahead of Jerry Seinfeld's commencement address
item.description: Jerry Seinfeld, who has supported Israel since the Oct. 7 attack by Hamas militants, delivered the commencement address at Duke University on Sunday.

item.title: Actor Steve Buscemi randomly assaulted in Manhattan, publicist says
item.description: Steve Buscemi was allegedly punched in the face in Manhattan's Kips Bay neighborhood last week.

item.title: 39 Years, 6 Months, 4 Days (2005) | 60 Minutes Archive
item.description: In 2005, Scott Pelley spoke with Charles Robert Jenkins, a former U.S. soldier who had deserted to North Korea in 1965, about the abuse and control he suffered over his nearly 40 years there.

item.title: Conservation group fighting to save Marilyn Monroe's Los Angeles home
item.description: The current owners of Marilyn Monroe's old Los Angeles home want to tear the building down. But a conservation group is hoping to save it and get the building labeled a landmark. Carter Evans has the story.

item.title: Artists in 4 cities create murals to celebrate moms
item.description: A group of artists in four U.S. cities have created murals to celebrate mothers. Meg Oliver takes a look at the unique creations.

item.title: Hollywood legend Roger Corman dies at age 98
item.description: Roger Corman, the Hollywood legend known for his prolific production of indie B-movies, has died at age 98. Elise Preston looks back at his legacy.

item.title: Michael Cohen expected to take stand in Trump trial on Monday
item.description: Following a weekend rally in New Jersey, former President Trump is due back in court on Monday for the continuation of his criminal "hush money" trial. Michael Cohen, Trump's one-time fixer, is expected to take the stand. Shanelle Kaul reports.

item.title: Palestinians flee Rafah as fighting continues
item.description: Parts of Rafah are now abandoned as Palestinians who were sheltering there amid the war have been forced to flee again. Fighting has also broken out again in the northern Gaza Strip. Ramy Inocencio reports.

item.title: Biden facing criticism as Israel strikes Rafah
item.description: As the civilian death toll in Gaza continues to climb, President Biden is facing criticism both for his continued support of Israel and for limiting weapons transfers to the country. Skyler Henry reports.

item.title: "CBS Weekend News" headlines for Sunday, May 12, 2024
item.description: Here's a look at the top stories making headlines on the "CBS Weekend News" with Jericka Duncan.

item.title: Reporting on the battle with Hezbollah in Metula, Israel
item.description: Lesley Stahl and a 60 Minutes team sheltered in a bunker during a drone attack on an Israeli border town that has increasingly come under fire from Hezbollah militants.

item.title: Veteran faces charges after he says he tried to help North Koreans defect
item.description: Christopher Ahn says he helped North Koreans defect as a volunteer with activist group Cheollima Civil Defense. Now he's facing criminal charges — and possibly assassination — after a mission gone wrong.

item.title: Veteran faces assassination threat after plan to help North Koreans defect
item.description: A U.S. Marine veteran says he was part of a failed fake kidnapping plot designed to help North Koreans in Spain defect. He's facing charges in Spain, where he believes he is at risk of assassination.

item.title: U.S., Israel "drifting apart," former head of Israeli army intelligence says
item.description: Amid heightened tensions with the U.S. over the humanitarian crisis in Gaza, Israel is continuing its war with Hamas in Gaza. It's also facing the Iran-backed Hezbollah to the north.

item.title: Israel preparing for Rafah invasion in Gaza amid increasing tension with U.S.
item.description: Israel, preparing for a possible Rafah invasion, faces increased tension with the U.S. over the Gaza humanitarian crisis. To the north, it's also confronting Hezbollah attacks coming in from Lebanon.

item.title: 60 Minutes Archive: Coverage of North Korea
item.description: To understand why American Christopher Ahn risked his life to help North Korean diplomats defect — and why North Koreas may want to surrender their own homeland — we turned to some of 60 Minutes' decades-long coverage of North Korea.

item.title: Actor Steve Buscemi randomly punched in Manhattan
item.description: The 66-year-old suffered an eye injury but is expected to be OK. CBS New York's Ali Bauman reports.

item.title: North Korea (2003) | 60 Minutes Archive
item.description: In 2003, Mike Wallace reported on North Korea, a country rarely visited by foreigners, where people lived in abject poverty, and disease and malnutrition were rampant.

item.title: Punxsutawney Groundhog Club reveals Phil and Phyllis' new babies' names
item.description: The Punxsutawney Groundhog Club Inner Circle announced on Facebook that two names had finally been chosen for Phil and his wife Phyllis' new babies, who were born in March.​​

item.title: Putin appoints Shoigu as secretary of Russia's national security council
item.description: The Kremlin on Sunday said Vladimir Putin has signed a decree appointing Sergei Shoigu as secretary of Russia's national security council, replacing Nikolai Patrushev.
